content:
• Wednesday, November 16, 2011
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) gains 5.2% AH after reporting Q3 revenue $47.5M (+207% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) gains 5.2% AH after reporting Q3 revenue $47.5M (+207% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15, blowing past Street estimates by $5.4M and $0.05. Online ad sales, which are tied to the distribution of Qihoo's browser, rose 227% Y/Y to $35.1M. The company is guiding for Q4 revenue of $55M-$56M, well above a consensus of $46.5M. Qihoo was recently the target of a bearish Citron Research report.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • YOKU

    More on Youku's (NYSE:YOKU) Q3 report: EPS hurt by 41% Q/Q increase in sales & marketing...

    More on Youku's (NYSE:YOKU) Q3 report: EPS hurt by 41% Q/Q increase in sales & marketing expenses, to $11.6M. Content costs were 26% of revenue, up slightly from Q2's 25%. Company expects Q4 revenue to be up 90%-100% Y/Y, below consensus for 107.7% growth. YOKU -15.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMAT

    More on Applied Materials' FQ4: Company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.08-$0.16, below an $0.18...

    More on Applied Materials' FQ4: Company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.08-$0.16, below an $0.18 consensus. Revenue expected to decline 5%-15% Q/Q, consensus is for 5.6% drop. Backlog fell 26% Q/Q to $2.39B. Display equipment orders -91% Q/Q to $20M. Solar orders -73% to $86M. Chip equipment orders -25% to $925M. Gross margin fell 350 bps Q/Q to 39%. AMAT -1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC -10%), hammered today along with many other oil refiners, is announcing a...

    HollyFrontier (HFC -10%), hammered today along with many other oil refiners, is announcing a one-time cash dividend of $0.50/share, and slightly boosting its quarterly dividend to $0.10/share. HFC +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • NTAP

    More on NetApp's (NASDAQ:NTAP) FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $1.52B-$1.61B and EPS of...

    More on NetApp's (NASDAQ:NTAP) FQ2: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $1.52B-$1.61B and EPS of $0.56-$0.60, below a consensus of $1.64B and $0.63. Company says it saw "unexpected weakness" in a handful of its largest accounts. Following a respectable Q3 from archrival EMC, the shortfall could raise fears of competitive pressure from EMC's VNX line. NTAP -6% AH. EMC -0.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM

  • Lake Shore Gold (LSG) closes up +8.3% after announcing the completion of an initial resource...

    Lake Shore Gold (LSG) closes up +8.3% after announcing the completion of an initial resource estimate for its wholly owned Thunder Creek property in Timmins, Ontario. The report estimates the stake contains up to 1M ounces of gold.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -13.9%) plummets after its big earnings miss on weak gross...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -13.9%) plummets after its big earnings miss on weak gross margins, but the company indicates in its conference call it would start raising prices next year, which could help boost margins. Brean Murray comes to its defense, keeping the faith in "robust European growth opportunities and that Asia also could be a burgeoning market."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +9.3%) is up strongly for the second straight day (previously)....

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +9.3%) is up strongly for the second straight day (previously). Shares could be getting a boost from Canaccord's Scott Van Winkle, who's again trumpeting the company's growth potential (previously). Some insider buying might also be helping; while the sums are small, they represent the first insider buys seen by Green Mountain in 3 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX +6.8%) gets a pop after the company says it's buying privately-held HealthConnect...

    Ebix (EBIX +6.8%) gets a pop after the company says it's buying privately-held HealthConnect Systems, which will be immediately integrated into its EbixHealth Division.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -60.4%) resumes trading after being halted in the wake of a federal jury's ruling...

    Rambus (RMBS -60.4%) resumes trading after being halted in the wake of a federal jury's ruling against the company in a case in which it had alleged Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix had conspired to prevent its computer memory technology from becoming an industry standard. Micron shares, also halted, now trading +21.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • CEDC

    Shares of Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) gain 16.6% on a reported short squeeze....

    Shares of Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) gain 16.6% on a reported short squeeze. It's only a relatively small recovery for a stock that has been been hammered - down 49% over the last month on downgrades and profit warnings - and still stands well-below the consensus price target of analysts of $5.88.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • GCOM

    Globecomm Systems (GCOM +7.3%) jumps after the company announced earlier that it's been awarded...

    Globecomm Systems (GCOM +7.3%) jumps after the company announced earlier that it's been awarded various infrastructure contracts valued at approximately $6.8M from a foreign government customer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM

  • Stocks have turned tail from a midday rally and sunk to new lows on the session. DJIA -1.5%,...

    Stocks have turned tail from a midday rally and sunk to new lows on the session. DJIA -1.5%, S&P 500 -1.5%, Nasdaq -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO -2.5%) takes a hit after the company says it's closing its nearly 40-year-old...

    Rio Tinto (RIO -2.5%) takes a hit after the company says it's closing its nearly 40-year-old Lynemouth smelter in Northumberland, England due to rising energy costs. The news follows last month's announcement that the company plans to streamline its aluminum product group.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks take a hit today on a 3% jump in oil: JetBlue (JBLU -2%), Delta (DAL -3.8%), AMR...

    Airline stocks take a hit today on a 3% jump in oil: JetBlue (JBLU -2%), Delta (DAL -3.8%), AMR Corp. (AMR -4.5%) and United Continental (UAL -4.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • RF

    Regions Financial (RF +3.5%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Deutsche earlier today,...

    Regions Financial (RF +3.5%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Deutsche earlier today, saying the stock remains one of its top regional picks. Deutsche notes the stock is trading at a lower P/E ratio than its peers - implying a lot of bad news is already priced in - and the bank's credit trends are moving in the right direction.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • PWR

    Quanta Services (PWR +4.7%) trades higher after saying earlier that Southern California Edison...

    Quanta Services (PWR +4.7%) trades higher after saying earlier that Southern California Edison has selected one of its subsidiaries to construct transmission infrastructure for the power company's Devers-Palo Verde 2 transmission project.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • EVLV

    ValueVision Media (VVTV +12.5%) pops despite its Q3 missing estimates earlier today. The company...

    ValueVision Media (VVTV +12.5%) pops despite its Q3 missing estimates earlier today. The company reported wider losses as two of its segments posted weaker-than-expected sales, but investors appear to be encouraged by better Y/Y performance and the actions the home-shopping retailer is taking to improve future revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • NG

    NovaGold (NG +26.8%) shares skyrocket on plans to spin out its Ambler copper project in Alaska...

    NovaGold (NG +26.8%) shares skyrocket on plans to spin out its Ambler copper project in Alaska to shareholders, forming a new NovaCopper subsidiary. The new unit will be led by company founder Rick Van Nieuwenhuyse, who stepped down as NovaGold's president and CEO to take on those positions at the new unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +7.1%) investors should focus on the big picture, Janney's Mitchell...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +7.1%) investors should focus on the big picture, Janney's Mitchell Pinheiro says: It sells coffee, "an above-average margin product demonstrating strong brand loyalty, and with a remarkable consistency in inelastic consumption." The "best single-cup brewer" reamins in demand with consumers, and inventory concerns are "not an issue."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix have prevailed in their antitrust dispute with Rambus...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix have prevailed in their antitrust dispute with Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS), as a jury rules the companies didn't engage in memory price-fixing. Micron and Rambus shares remain halted. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC +5.8%) is trading higher today after its FQ4 results easily beat Street estimates....

    Tyco (TYC +5.8%) is trading higher today after its FQ4 results easily beat Street estimates. Profit rose 50% Y/Y on strong revenue gains across all its main businesses lines. Margins also improved due to fewer charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • SLRC

    Shares of Solar Capital (SLRC -2.1%) trade lower after Wells Fargo cut its rating to Market...

    Shares of Solar Capital (SLRC -2.1%) trade lower after Wells Fargo cut its rating to Market Perform on valuation. The bank says the stock has hit its price target after a solid 17% run since the beginning of October.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +10.3%) spikes higher after Wedbush lifts its PT to $31 from $15 (implies a...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +10.3%) spikes higher after Wedbush lifts its PT to $31 from $15 (implies a 300%+ gain), and argues shares have a "highly asymmetric" risk-reward going into the expected Q1 2012 release of Phase III trial data for its Stimuvax cancer vaccine. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +1.8%) and Micron (MU +4.4%) shares have been halted ahead of a pending verdict in...

    Rambus (RMBS +1.8%) and Micron (MU +4.4%) shares have been halted ahead of a pending verdict in their bitter antitrust case. The verdict is due at 2 P.M. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • XUE

    Xueda Education (NYSE:XUE), a Chinese provider of tutoring services, is up 7.9% after reporting...

    Xueda Education (NYSE:XUE), a Chinese provider of tutoring services, is up 7.9% after reporting Q3 revenue of $51.5M (+32% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.07; the former beat by $0.6M, while the latter was in-line. Xueda, whose shares were down 74% YTD going into its report, expects Q4 revenue of $41M-$44M, compared with a $43.6M consensus. Possibly rising in sympathy: OTCPK:CAST +3.4%. EDU +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • VICL

    Vical (VICL +2.6%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates coverage on the shares with an Outperform...

    Vical (VICL +2.6%) gains after Credit Suisse initiates coverage on the shares with an Outperform rating and a $7 price target. The firm says the company has a solid pipeline and its lead product Allovectin, a treatment of metastatic melanoma, is in Phase III trials and looks promising.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • GTATQ

    Solar and LED equipment maker GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +7%) rallies after signing off on a...

    Solar and LED equipment maker GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +7%) rallies after signing off on a $100M stock buyback, of which $75M will occur through an "accelerated repurchase" on or around Nov. 21. At current levels, the buyback is good for roughly 9% of GT's outstanding shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares in biotech Dendreon (DNDN +9.7%) are halted after hitting circuit breakers to the upside....

    Shares in biotech Dendreon (DNDN +9.7%) are halted after hitting circuit breakers to the upside. Update at 1:18: Shares back online now, +5.7%. No news has yet hit giving a reason for the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • KEY

    KeyBanc (KEY +1.4%) gains after Raymond James ups the shares to Outperform, citing the bank's...

    KeyBanc (KEY +1.4%) gains after Raymond James ups the shares to Outperform, citing the bank's accelerating commercial loan growth and improved net interest margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport-McMoran (FCX -1.9%) cuts its already slashed production estimates due to the ongoing...

    Freeport-McMoran (FCX -1.9%) cuts its already slashed production estimates due to the ongoing strike at its Papua, New Guinea mine. Estimating production rates at 75% of normal one month ago, "we're going to have to adjust that downward," says the CEO, as work has come to a complete stoppage since October 22.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) take a turn for the worse after gaining over 2% in morning trading...

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) take a turn for the worse after gaining over 2% in morning trading on the back of a Credit Suisse upgrade - and now stand down 6.4% on above-average volume. Chatter ties the sharp turnaround to either a technical breakdown or good old fashioned profit-taking depending upon the source.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN +2.5%) shares are on the move after iFixit said last night it discovered...

    Texas Instruments (TXN +2.5%) shares are on the move after iFixit said last night it discovered a TI processor at the core of the new Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire. Stifel Nicolaus believes more than $30 of TI components may be in the device, and that Kindle Fire sales may account for $150M-plus, or ~4.4%, of TI's Q4 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +8.4%) jumps after Reuters reports that the EU plans to conditionally...

    Western Digital (WDC +8.4%) jumps after Reuters reports that the EU plans to conditionally approve its bid to acquire Hitachi's (HIT -1.4%) hard disk drive business. Separately, the company also says it's inked a supply agreement with TDK for hard-disk-drive components starting in the first quarter, which should alleviate some of the production problems the company is experiencing due to  Thailand floods. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • PM

    Philip Morris (PM +0.9%) pops as CEO Louis Camilleri - speaking at a Morgan Stanley conference -...

    Philip Morris (PM +0.9%) pops as CEO Louis Camilleri - speaking at a Morgan Stanley conference - raises the company's FY11 EPS outlook to at least 4.85, the top of a previous range of $4.75-4.85. Consensus estimates were for $4.82.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +2.3%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse, saying...

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +2.3%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse, saying the company's business is improving with a growing backlog, improved pricing and better visibility going into 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • ZLTQ

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -5.4%), which went public in October, is selling off after reporting Q3...

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -5.4%), which went public in October, is selling off after reporting Q3 revenue of $17.7M (+175% Y/Y) and GAAP EPS of -$3.17 (not a typo). The company's installed base of fat-reduction systems rose by 183 units in Q3, to 812, but its gross margin fell 250 bps to 58.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.1%) moves higher on the day the first Nook Tablet units arrive on...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +2.1%) moves higher on the day the first Nook Tablet units arrive on store shelves. B&N says the Nook Tablet is launching to "big order volume," though it doesn't provide any numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +3.2%) gains after Global Hunter initiates the shares this morning with a...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +3.2%) gains after Global Hunter initiates the shares this morning with a Neutral rating. The firm says the stock has been on a tear recently, due in large part to to the success of its Utica Shale position. However, when you dig deeper into the company you find it also has a strong balance sheet, solid cash flows and is fairly balanced between oil and gas, as well as long-life and short-life reserves.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • WLMS

    Global Power Equipment (GLPW -3.2%) dips after BB&T Capital downgrades the shares to Hold...

    Global Power Equipment (GLPW -3.2%) dips after BB&T Capital downgrades the shares to Hold from Buy on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (FOSL +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies sings the apparel maker's praises following an...

    Fossil (FOSL +3.4%) trades higher after Jefferies sings the apparel maker's praises following an analyst meeting. Jefferies believes Fossil can deliver 20% long-term revenue and EPS growth, fueled in part by strong Chinese sales, and is especially bullish on its Michael Kors brand. Fossil shares fell last week on a Q4 guidance cut.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum (CENX -3.4%) dips after divulging that former President and CEO Logan Kruger...

    Century Aluminum (CENX -3.4%) dips after divulging that former President and CEO Logan Kruger has left the company and is suing for wrongful termination. The board names CFO Michael Bless to replace him.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX +5.1%) pops after the company releases specific data from a study...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX +5.1%) pops after the company releases specific data from a study on its LibiGel testosterone gel. The report supports earlier claims that the treatment successfully increased free-testosterone levels in postmenopausal women.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (ADSK +5.8%) jumps after its Q3 results easily topped analysts' expectations yesterday....

    Autodesk (ADSK +5.8%) jumps after its Q3 results easily topped analysts' expectations yesterday. Profit jumped 36% Y/Y as better cost controls boosted margins and the company reported strong revenue growth from all of its main markets. Separately, Brigantine ups the shares to Buy on the back of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    As investors worry that Dell's (DELL-OLD -2.2%) drop in Q3 revenue could be an indication of...

    As investors worry that Dell's (DELL-OLD -2.2%) drop in Q3 revenue could be an indication of things to come, shares are downgraded by FBN with a price target reduced to $20 from $23. A tougher pricing environment forces Dell to choose between losing share or accepting lower margins, and prices for hard disk drives have spiked since the Thailand floods, FBN says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • FBC

    Cantor Fitzgerald weighs in on Flagstar Bancorp (FBC +6.7%), ringing up a Buy rating and a price...

    Cantor Fitzgerald weighs in on Flagstar Bancorp (FBC +6.7%), ringing up a Buy rating and a price target increase to $1.50 after meeting with senior management. Analysts with the firm say positive takeaways from the face-to-face along with confirming Q3 earnings were behind its upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • THC

    Shares of Tenet Healthcare (THC -2.8%) are lower this morning on a Leerink Swann downgrade to...

    Shares of Tenet Healthcare (THC -2.8%) are lower this morning on a Leerink Swann downgrade to Market Perform, The firm cites investor fatigue and says there are more attractive names in the healthcare services space.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • COP

    Refiners are getting slammed as the Conoco (NYSE:COP) deal will squeeze profit margins by...

    Refiners are getting slammed as the Conoco (NYSE:COP) deal will squeeze profit margins by eliminating some of the glut of cheap oil at Cushing. Phillip Dunham notes the rally in refiners was "all about the Brent-WTI spread, not organic growth. Nice job with late summer upgrades, sell side." Valero VLO -5.7%, Western Refining WNR -8.5%, Marathon MPC -6.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • REXX

    Shares of Rex Energy (REXX +4.6%) take flight after nabbing an initiation with Global Hunter...

    Shares of Rex Energy (REXX +4.6%) take flight after nabbing an initiation with Global Hunter Securities at Buy with a lofty price target of $23. Analysts with the firm cite the energy concern's well-positioned stakes in various oil and gas fields.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN) opened for trading at $8.30, and is currently changing hands at $8.60, up...

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN) opened for trading at $8.30, and is currently changing hands at $8.60, up 14.5% from its IPO price of $7.50. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • UNIS

    Unilife (UNIS -11.6%) drops like a rock after the company announces an underwritten public...

    Unilife (UNIS -11.6%) drops like a rock after the company announces an underwritten public offering of 8.25M shares of common stock at $4.35/share. The underwriters of the offering have an option to purchase an additional 1.24M shares of the medical device company within a 30-day period.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 3 Comments
  • CHE

    Shares of Chemed (CHE -7.9%) trade lower after a whistleblower accuses the firm of an extensive...

    Shares of Chemed (CHE -7.9%) trade lower after a whistleblower accuses the firm of an extensive Medicare HMO scheme aimed at defrauding the government. The allegations were unveiled in a lawsuit filed in a federal case against the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) +3% premarket after announcing its Phase 3 study on a potential therapy for...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) +3% premarket after announcing its Phase 3 study on a potential therapy for patients with high tryglyceride levels who are also on statin therapy for elevated LDL cholesterol levels met its primary endpoint. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • XPER

    Tessera (TSRA), a developer of miniaturization technology for wireless and computing products,...

    Tessera (TSRA), a developer of miniaturization technology for wireless and computing products, surges 16.1% after Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) renews a license agreement until May 2017. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • COP

    An interesting thought from Mike Bergen on the move higher in WTI crude this morning: Conoco's...

    An interesting thought from Mike Bergen on the move higher in WTI crude this morning: Conoco's (NYSE:COP) sale of a pipeline to Enbridge (NYSE:ENB) means its flow will reverse to the Gulf Coast, reducing supply to Cushing refineries in Oklahoma where WTI is priced. Brent crude (BNO -1.8%) moving down as WTI (USO +1%) moves higher lends credence to this theory.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • CIM

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) catches a downgrade from Wunderlich Securities in advance of its...

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) catches a downgrade from Wunderlich Securities in advance of its earnings release today. Analysts with the firm take their rating down to Sell from Hold, while trimming the price target for CIM to $2.50. Shares -2.5% premarket after catching fire yesterday with a 10.6% gain on news about its pending 10Q filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • XPER

    Premarket leaders: TSRA +14%. WDC +4%.TGT +3%. BPAX +3%. VELT +3%.Losers: MFN -11%. ANF -7%....

    Premarket leaders: TSRA +14%. WDC +4%.TGT +3%. BPAX +3%. VELT +3%.
    Losers: MFN -11%. ANF -7%. IDIX -6%. NBG -4%. DANG -3%. FRO -3%. RIO -3%. ALU -3%. AREX -3%. HBC -3%. AMR -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • USO

    Crude oil continues to make its way higher regardless of the shakiness of world economies and...

    Crude oil continues to make its way higher regardless of the shakiness of world economies and financial markets, WTI pushing through $100/barrel for the first time since mid-summer. USO +0.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    AMR's board may need to weigh a bankruptcy filing after stepped-up talks with pilots have failed...

    AMR's board may need to weigh a bankruptcy filing after stepped-up talks with pilots have failed to produce an agreement on a new labor contract. Directors should consider alternatives now rather than watch cash reserves keep dwindling without an agreement, Sterne Agee's Jeff Kauffman says. AMR sank 10% yesterday to $1.92, its lowest close since March 2003; shares -2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM

  • Like a drug with an ever-diminishing impact, the effect of the ECB's bondbuying has worn off...

    Like a drug with an ever-diminishing impact, the effect of the ECB's bondbuying has worn off already as Italian bond yields pass 7% again after falling earlier; they do seem to have stabilized a bit since Mario Monti named his cabinet, with himself as finmin.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is down 2.4% following a mixed FQ3 report, as concerns about weak consumer PC...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is down 2.4% following a mixed FQ3 report, as concerns about weak consumer PC sales outweigh strong margins and enterprise growth. Evidence of Dell's attempts to lessen its PC dependence can be found in CC remarks about its R&D spending now approaching a $1B annual rate. Remarks about an expected increase in SSD adoption thanks to Thai flooding could be positive for OCZ and STEC.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • ANF

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (NYSE:ANF) FQ3 report: The EPS shortfall was largely due to...

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (NYSE:ANF) FQ3 report: The EPS shortfall was largely due to higher-than-expected clothing costs, which led to Abercrombie's gross margin falling 350 bps Q/Q, to 60.1%. Same-store sales were up 7% Y/Y, compared with 9% in Q2. A&F same-store sales rose 4%; Abercrombie Kids rose 6%; and Hollister Co. rose 8%. ANF -11% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 3 Comments

  • Eurozone sovereign-debt markets seem to be a bit calmer as Italian and Spanish 10-year bond...

    Eurozone sovereign-debt markets seem to be a bit calmer as Italian and Spanish 10-year bond yields fall ahead of the expected formation today of Mario Monti's new government. The Italian 10-year yield is -26 bps at 6.813% and the Spanish equivalent is -11 bps at 6.23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 AM | 1 Comment
